bill.title: Mississippi Electronic Protection Licensing Act; make various amendments to.
bill.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-69-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Change The Name Of The "mississippi Residential Electronic Protection Licensing Act" To "mississippi Electronic Protection Licensing Act"; To Amend Section 73-69-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Purpose Of The Act; To Amend Section 73-69-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define The Terms "alarm Verification" And "electronic Access Control System" And To Revise The Definition Of Other Terms; To Amend Section 73-69-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State Fire Marshal To Subpoena Records; To Amend Section 73-69-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Any Entity Desiring To Engage In Alarm Contracting Shall Hold A Class A Alarm Contracting Business License Issued By The State Fire Marshal; To Amend Section 73-69-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Provision Allowing Certain Persons To Become Automatically Licensed Without Showing Proof Of Satisfaction Of Educational Requirements; To Amend Section 73-69-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Classifications Of Licenses; To Amend Section 73-69-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Exemptions From Licensure; To Amend Section 73-69-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase Certain License Fees; To Amend Section 73-69-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Classification Of Offenses; To Amend Section 73-69-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Penalties For Violations Of The Act; To Amend Section 73-69-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Amend Section 73-69-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make Technical Corrections; And For Related Purposes.

step.action: Referred To Business and Financial Institutions
